alert.note: Alert for Central Greenville; Greater Pickens; Greenville Mountains; Pickens Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GREENVILLE...NORTH CENTRAL ANDERSON AND PICKENS COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 313 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles northwest of Easley to near Pickens to 7 miles northeast of Clemson. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Easley, Pickens, West Greenville, Berea, Welcome, Powdersville, Travelers Rest, Liberty, and Slater-Marietta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Greenville; Greater Pickens; Greenville Mountains; Pickens Mountains
